alert.note: Alert for Clark (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 24 at 9:38PM CDT until further notice by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Iowa... Illinois...Missouri... Mississippi River at Keokuk LD19 affecting Hancock, Lee and Clark Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY MORNING UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Mississippi River at Keokuk LD19. * WHEN...From Friday morning until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 18.4 feet, U.S. Highway 61 closes at the bridge over the Des Moines River between Alexandria and Keokuk. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:10 PM CDT Monday the stage was 13.5 feet and rising. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage Friday morning and continue rising to 17.9 feet early Monday afternoon. Additional rises are possible thereafter. - Flood stage is 16.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/quadcities. The next statement will be issued Tuesday morning.
